column4: hi, i am new to ubuntu and linux. i just recently dual booted windows 7 with ubuntu following a guide on lifehacker. it said to make three partitions, one being a shared storage partition accessible from both operating system's. upon talking to a friend i realized it is not necessary to have a shared partition as it would be easier just to mount the windows partition while in linux. so i decided delete the shared partition. when i restarted m
your message was truncated at "i restarted m"
btw, im in live cd mode right now
ok here's the rest. "when i restarted my computer there was an error. it read "GRUB Loading. error: no such partition". what should i do?
